original: @84a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @84a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: rakta ya m'a ri s'a dha na bi dhi /
analyzed: rakta ya m'a ri s'a dha na bi dhi /
translated: Raktayamarisādhanavidhi

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽The ritual of the practice of Red Yamāri

original: gshin rje gshed dmar po'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga / dpal gshin rje gshed dmar po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed dmar po'i sgrub thabs kyi cho ga / dpal gshin rje gshed dmar po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Red Yamāri.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'ah'a /
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: nam:lha spyin bdag gi sh'antim ku ru nam:sv'a h'a /
analyzed: nam:lha spyin bdag gi sh'antim ku ru nam:sv'a h'a /
translated: Namas! May Devadatta's peace be accomplished! Svāhā.

original: 'di ni zhi ba'o //🔽rgya skags sam /
analyzed: 'di ni zhi ba'o // rgya skags sam /
translated: This is for peace.

original: tsandan dmar po la ming med kyi khrag dang bsres pas bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: tsandan dmar po la ming med kyi khrag dang bsres pas bri bar bya'o //
translated: Write it with Indian ink or with the blood of a nameless person mixed with red sandalwood.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat ho:/
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat ho:/
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ hoḥ.

original: lha spyin bdag gi ba shyam ku ru ho //
analyzed: lha spyin bdag gi ba shyam ku ru ho //
translated: May Devadatta's desire be accomplished! Hoḥ.

original: ba shyam ku ru boo shat /
analyzed: ba shyam ku ru boo shat /
translated: Accomplish the desire! Vaṣaṭ.

original: dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for enthralling.

original: ras la @84b rgya skags kyi khu bas /
analyzed: ras la @84b rgya skags kyi khu bas /
translated: On cloth, with Indian ink,

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat dza hr'i: che ge mo bdag la a'a karsha ya hr'i:dza: rkang pa dgug pa'o //
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat dza hr'i: che ge mo bdag la a'a karsha ya hr'i:dza: rkang pa dgug pa'o //
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ śrīḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ jaḥ hrīḥ! Draw in such-and-such a person to me! Hrīḥ jaḥ. This is for summoning the feet.

original: ras la ba bla 'am /
analyzed: ras la ba bla 'am /
translated: or on cloth,🔽

original: yung ba'i khu bas /
analyzed: yung ba'i khu bas /
translated: On cloth, with the juice of babhla or🔽indigo.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: lam aa de ba lha spyin svasthan'a ta stambha ya stambha ya lam /
analyzed: lam aa de ba lha spyin svasthan'a ta stambha ya stambha ya lam /
translated: Lam adeva devadatta sthaṃ sthānaṃ staṃbha staṃbha lam.

original: rengs pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: rengs pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: The rite of paralyzing.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat bam /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat bam /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ vaṃ.

original: lha spyin gyi mu kham bandha ma no bandha mu kham /
analyzed: lha spyin gyi mu kham bandha ma no bandha mu kham /
translated: Devadatta's mukhaṃ bandha mano bandha mukhaṃ.

original: ku ru bam mo h'a ya bya ba ha ra bi shya bam /
analyzed: ku ru bam mo h'a ya bya ba ha ra bi shya bam /
translated: Kurū vaṃ mohaya bhava hara viśya vaṃ.

original: ras la dug dang ske tshe dang tsha ba'i mar nag dang / nags kyi nim pa'i 'dab ma dang / da du ra'i 'dab ma'i khu ba dang / ro bsregs pa'i sol ba dang thal ba dang khrag gis bya rog gi sgro'i smyu gus /
analyzed: ras la dug dang ske tshe dang tsha ba'i mar nag dang / nags kyi nim pa'i 'dab ma dang / da du ra'i 'dab ma'i khu ba dang / ro bsregs pa'i sol ba dang thal ba dang khrag gis bya rog gi sgro'i smyu gus /
translated: On cloth, with the juice of poison, black mustard, and hot oil, leaves of forest nimba and datura, and the ash and blood of a burnt corpse, with a pen of a crow's feather,

original: aom hr'i:shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri: wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: lha spyin m'a ra ya h'um /
analyzed: lha spyin m'a ra ya h'um /
translated: Devadatta māraya hūṃ.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat ha ra che ge mo m'a ra ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat ha ra che ge mo m'a ra ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ hara so-and-so māraya hūṃ phaṭ.🔽

original: gsad pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gsad pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the killing rite.

original: de kho na bzhin du /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: lha spyin dang mchod spyin dag / bi de sha ya h'um phat che ge mo nyid kyi /
analyzed: lha spyin dang mchod spyin dag / bi de sha ya h'um phat che ge mo nyid kyi /
translated: Devadatta and Yajñadatta, bhid bhid, hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: che ge mo'i ye na ke na tsi dza gri na yantra mantra bi sha ts'urna pra yo ga ti ta ta sarbba auta gh'a ta ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: che ge mo'i ye na ke na tsi dza gri na yantra mantra bi sha ts'urna pra yo ga ti ta ta sarbba auta gh'a ta ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Devadatta's yantra, mantra, and poison, all the obstacles are destroyed, svāhā.

original: dang por 'khor lo btu bar bya ste /
analyzed: dang por 'khor lo btu bar bya ste /
translated: First, the wheel should be drawn.

original: rtsibs brgyad pa 'am /
analyzed: rtsibs brgyad pa 'am /
translated: With eight spokes or

original: rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i dbus su ya /
analyzed: rtsibs bcu gnyis pa'i dbus su ya /
translated: twelve spokes, in the center is ya.

original: shar du kshe /
analyzed: shar du kshe /
translated: In the east is kṣe.

original: lhor ma / nub tu me /
analyzed: lhor ma / nub tu me /
translated: In the south is ma, in the west is me.

original: byang du yi ge da /
analyzed: byang du yi ge da /
translated: In the north is the syllable da.

original: ye ge ya dang por byas pa'i /
analyzed: ye ge ya dang por byas pa'i /
translated: Taking the syllable ya at the beginning,

original: r'a dza ya sa do ru na yo ni ra yatstsha ni 'dab ma bcu gnyis su bri'o //
analyzed: r'a dza ya sa do ru na yo ni ra yatstsha ni 'dab ma bcu gnyis su bri'o //
translated: rā ja ya sa do ru na yo ni ra ya tscha ni is written on the twelve petals.

original: rtsibs bcu drug tu re re'i bar du bcug pa'i re'u mig la /
analyzed: rtsibs bcu drug tu re re'i bar du bcug pa'i re'u mig la /
translated: In the sixteen spokes, in each of the squares inserted between them,

original: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:wi kri t'a na na h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ vikṛtānana hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: One should write this and so forth.

original: re'u mig gzhan brgyad du /
analyzed: re'u mig gzhan brgyad du /
translated: In the other eight squares,

original: aom hr'i:shtri:la sogs pa rdzogs pa dang / sv'a h'a mthar bri ste lha spyin gyi sh'antim ku ru pushtim ku ru ba shyam ku ru /
analyzed: aom hr'i:shtri:la sogs pa rdzogs pa dang / sv'a h'a mthar bri ste lha spyin gyi sh'antim ku ru pushtim ku ru ba shyam ku ru /
translated: Oṃ hṛiḥ śṛiḥ and so forth are completed, and at the end svāhā is written. One should write śāntikaṃ kuru, puṣṭikaṃ kuru, vaśyaṃ kuru,

original: stambha ya mo ha ya /
analyzed: stambha ya mo ha ya /
translated: stambhaya, mohaya,

original: bi dve sha ya /
analyzed: bi dve sha ya /
translated: vidveṣaya,

original: autstsha ta ya /
analyzed: autstsha ta ya /
translated: ucchādaya,

original: m'a ra y'a mu kam ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽zhes bya ba bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: m'a ra y'a mu kam ku ru sv'a h'a / zhes bya ba bri bar bya'o //
translated: māraṇaṃ kuru svāhā.

original: phyogs bral du lha spyin gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bral du lha spyin gyi ming ngo //
translated: In the intermediate directions, one should write Devadatta.

original: gshin rje gshed dmar sgrub ba'i thabs //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed dmar sgrub ba'i thabs //
translated: The method of accomplishing Red Yamāri🔽is complete.

original: bris la dge ba gang bsags pa //
analyzed: bris la dge ba gang bsags pa //
translated: Whatever virtue has been accumulated🔽by writing this,

original: de yis myur du sems can rnams //
analyzed: de yis myur du sems can rnams //
translated: may all sentient beings quickly🔽attain the supreme bliss.

original: bde ba myur du mchog thob shog / dpal dpa' bo'i rgyal pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bde ba myur du mchog thob shog / dpal dpa' bo'i rgyal pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: By Śrī Śūra-rāja.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bla ma rje btsun nyi ma'i dbang po'i 'od zer gyi zhal snga nas dang / chag lo ts'a @85a * //
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bla ma rje btsun nyi ma'i dbang po'i 'od zer gyi zhal snga nas dang / chag lo ts'a @85a * //
translated: The Indian abbot, the venerable lord Sūryavairocanaprabhā, and the Tibetan translator Chak Lotsāwa

original: ba dge slong chos rje dpal gyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: ba dge slong chos rje dpal gyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
translated: The Indian abbot, the venerable lord Sūryavairocanaprabhā, and the Tibetan translator, the monk Chöje Pal, translated, revised, and finalized this text.
